message.content:
cs.PL, cs.LO, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.DS 

This paper deals with abstract domains for detecting sharing properties in logic programs, which is a topic closely related to programming languages and formal methods. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.PL (Programming Languages). The paper also involves formal reasoning and optimization, which could place it in cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Additionally, the paper discusses the use of abstract domains in software engineering, which could make cs.SE (Software Engineering) a relevant sub-category. The paper also touches on functional programming, which could make cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the analysis of logic programs, which could make cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a relevant sub-category.
